{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3398165,"name":"James","username":"ForgottenRussian","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/f/b9e5f3/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-06-12T18:50:00.937Z","cooked":"

Our team has encountered an issue where the front left wheel exhibits a slower transition to its intended state compared to the other wheels, which respond promptly to the controller’s commands. We have tested our code along with the Rev example bot which has failed to resolve the problem. we are confident that the issue does not stem from a programming error.

we have tried replacing the NEO motors and adjusting the CAN IDs associated with the affected wheel, yet the problem persists. To isolate the issue further, we disassembled the entire robot, retaining only the base with the four MaxSwerve motors.

drive.google.com

20240612_112935.mp4

Google Drive file.

the leftmost wheel lags significantly behind the others, which respond promptly to commands. We have investigated potential causes, exhaustively eliminating various possibilities. Any responses will help

Thank you in advance.
